Returns: A list of intent filters that specifies the media control intents that this route supports.
getControlFilters().Description: Gets a list of @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaControlIntent_E@ filters that describe the capabilities of this route and the media control actions that it supports.

Returns: The volume at which the playback associated with this route is performed.
getVolume().Description: Gets the current volume for this route. Depending on the route, this may only be valid if the route is currently selected.

Returns: True if this route can disconnect without stopping playback, false otherwise.
canDisconnect().Description: Gets whether this route supports disconnecting without interrupting playback.

Returns: True if this route is in the process of connecting.
isConnecting().Description: Returns true if the route is in the process of connecting and is not yet ready for use.

Parameters: int: The new volume value between 0 and @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter#RouteInfo#getVolumeMax_E@.
requestSetVolume(int).Description: Requests a volume change for this route asynchronously. This function may only be called on a selected route. It will have no effect if the route is currently unselected.

getSettingsIntent().Description: Gets an intent sender for launching a settings activity for this route.

Returns: True if this route is enabled.
isEnabled().Description: Returns true if this route is enabled and may be selected.

Returns: The URI of the icon representing this route, or null if none.
getIconUri().Description: Gets the URI of the icon representing this route. This icon will be used in picker UIs if available.

Returns: The type of playback associated with this route: @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter#RouteInfo#PLAYBACK_TYPE_LOCAL_E@ or @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter#RouteInfo#PLAYBACK_TYPE_REMOTE_E@.
getPlaybackType().Description: Gets the type of playback associated with this route.

Returns: The description of the route, or null if none.
getDescription().Description: Gets the user-visible description of the route. The route description describes the kind of destination represented by the route. It may be a user-supplied string, a model number or brand of device.

Returns: The connection state of this route: @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter#RouteInfo#CONNECTION_STATE_DISCONNECTED_E@, @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter#RouteInfo#CONNECTION_STATE_CONNECTING_E@, or @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter#RouteInfo#CONNECTION_STATE_CONNECTED_E@.
getConnectionState().Description: Gets the connection state of the route.

Returns: The type of the receiver device associated with this route: @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter#RouteInfo#DEVICE_TYPE_TV_E@ or @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter#RouteInfo#DEVICE_TYPE_SPEAKER_E@.
getDeviceType().Description: Gets the type of the receiver device associated with this route.

getExtras().Description: Gets a collection of extra properties about this route that were supplied by its media route provider, or null if none.

Returns: True if this route is a bluetooth route.
isBluetooth().Description: Returns true if this route is a bluetooth route.

Returns: The unique id of the route, never null.
getId().Description: Gets the unique id of the route. The route unique id functions as a stable identifier by which the route is known. For example, an application can use this id as a token to remember the selected route across restarts or to communicate its identity to a service.

Returns: The user-visible name of a media route. This is the string presented to users who may select this as the active route.
getName().Description: Gets the user-visible name of the route. The route name identifies the destination represented by the route. It may be a user-supplied name, an alias, or device serial number.

Returns: True if this route is currently selected.
isSelected().Description: Returns true if this route is currently selected.

Returns: True if this route is the default route and the device speaker.
isDeviceSpeaker().Description: Returns true if this route is the default route and the device speaker.

Parameters: int: The delta to add to the current volume.
requestUpdateVolume(int).Description: Requests an incremental volume update for this route asynchronously. This function may only be called on a selected route. It will have no effect if the route is currently unselected.

Returns: The maximum volume at which the playback associated with this route is performed.
getVolumeMax().Description: Gets the maximum volume at which the playback associated with this route is performed.

Returns: True if this route is the default route.
isDefault().Description: Returns true if this route is the default route.

Returns: a string representation of the object.
toString().Description: Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method. The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of:

Returns: The stream over which the playback associated with this route is performed.
getPlaybackStream().Description: Gets the audio stream over which the playback associated with this route is performed.

getProvider().Description: Gets information about the provider of this media route.

Returns: How volume is handled on the route: @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter#RouteInfo#PLAYBACK_VOLUME_FIXED_E@ or @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter#RouteInfo#PLAYBACK_VOLUME_VARIABLE_E@.
getVolumeHandling().Description: Gets information about how volume is handled on the route.

Returns: True if the route supports the specified intent category.
Parameters: String: A @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaControlIntent_E@ category such as @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaControlIntent#CATEGORY_LIVE_AUDIO_E@, @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaControlIntent#CATEGORY_LIVE_VIDEO_E@, @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaControlIntent#CATEGORY_REMOTE_PLAYBACK_E@, or a provider-defined media control category.
supportsControlCategory(java.lang.String.Description: Returns true if the route supports the specified @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaControlIntent_E@ category. Media control categories describe the capabilities of this route such as whether it supports live audio streaming or remote playback.

Returns: True if the route can handle the specified intent.
supportsControlRequest(android.content.I.Description: Returns true if the route supports the specified @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaControlIntent_E@ request. Media control requests are used to request the route to perform actions such as starting remote playback of a media item.

Returns: The preferred presentation display to use when this route is selected or null if none.
getPresentationDisplay().Description: Gets the @B_android#view#Display_E@ that should be used by the application to show a @B_android#app#Presentation_E@ on an external display when this route is selected. Depending on the route, this may only be valid if the route is currently selected. The preferred presentation display may change independently of the route being selected or unselected. For example, the presentation display of the default system route may change when an external HDMI display is connected or disconnected even though the route itself has not changed. This method may return null if there is no external display associated with the route or if the display is not ready to show UI yet. The application should listen for changes to the presentation display using the @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter#Callback#onRoutePresentationDisplayChanged_E@ callback and show or dismiss its @B_android#app#Presentation_E@ accordingly when the display becomes available or is removed. This method only makes sense for @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaControlIntent#CATEGORY_LIVE_VIDEO_E@ routes.

ClassDesc: Provides information about a media route. Each media route has a list of @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaControlIntent_E@ @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter#RouteInfo#getControlFilters_E@ that describe the capabilities of the route and the manner in which it is used and controlled.
